ranked_diseases.explanation: Noonan Syndrome is a common genetic disorder associated with clinodactyly and abnormal facial shape, among other features.
Turner Syndrome can present with clinodactyly and distinct facial features, though it is typically associated with females.
Down Syndrome often includes clinodactyly and characteristic facial features, though other symptoms are usually present.
Russell-Silver Syndrome can present with clinodactyly and abnormal facial shape, though it is more commonly associated with growth retardation.
Cri-du-Chat Syndrome may include clinodactyly and distinct facial features, though it is rare and usually accompanied by severe intellectual disability.
